text: Thanks to Brian for this treat! Liquide très sombre voire presque noir aux reflets roux et bruns. Une belle tête claire et floconneuse se forme lors du service et demeure en place un temps appréciable. Dominante du côté Barley Wine dans ce blend bien barriqué et dense. Arômes de malts chocolats, de biscuits chocolatés, de pain grillé, de caramel. Des arômes décadents et habituellement réconfortants qui ici me paraissent étonnamment froids et peu réconfortants. Saveurs très serrées de chocolat noir. Texture plutôt sèche qui manque donctuosité et de souplesse. Effervescence adéquate. Beaucoup de malts grillés et de barrique dalcool aux notes épicées. À la longue, un goût ferreux et métallique sinstalle à larrière de ma langue et me gêne. Possiblement que le blend 2 me conviendra davantage. À suivre très prochainement...
A decadent blend of barrels, roasted malts, vanilla, oak and chocolate with s some light coffee notes for good measure. Dark brown pour, strong aroma and flavor. Smoother than blend 2.

500ml bottle from Healthy Spirits. Black and thick with a lasting tan head. Aroma is bourbon, toffee, dark berries, molasses, chocolate. Flavor is mildly sweet, nice bourbon, slightly bitter finish. Feel is fairly hot, but smooth, light carbonation. Good, in the same vein as Bourbon County, even reminiscent of 50/50 Eclipse.

Glass: AleSmith Barrel-Aged Reserve snifter glass 
From: Saint Archer Brewing Company in San Diego, Calif.
Price: $12.99
Purchased: April 24, 2016
Consumed: Sept. 23, 2016
Reviewed as: American Strong Ale
Misc.: Black waxed on neck of bottle; Bottled in Jan. 2016 (educated guess)

Had this at their brewery on tap back in April and picked up a bottle. Wrote on Untappd then that it was, Hot and boozy. If it was bottled in January like I think it was, this should be close to being ready considering I age my stuff in a cabinet and not a cellar. Heres to hopefully a good one.

Poured an almost pitch black color with two fingers of frothy tan head. Very good lacing. Very good retention. (Sight - 4.00)

Smelled bourbon, chocolate, toffee and dark fruit, initially coming in hot, but mellowing out as it went down. Also milk chocolate, oaky notes, vanilla, cocoa nibs, hazelnut, roasty malts and some dark mocha notes. Reminding me slightly of AleSmiths Reforged, but maybe a tad darker. (Smell - 4.50)

Taste wasnt quite as good as the smell. Some more time on this would do wonders. Much darker than I would have thought, getting dark milk chocolate, hazelnut, boozy bourbon, dark cocoa nibs, dark fruits (plum?), oaky notes, vanilla, char wood, roasted toffee, a touch of dark tobacco and chocolate syrup. 12.5 pct. ABV is well hidden. (Taste - 4.00)

Full body. Sticky texture. Average carbonation. Long, warming finish. (Feel - 4.50)

Really liked this. Wouldve liked it more if I would have waited a few more months. (Overall - 4.25)

4.22 94 A-

Bottle shared by alexsdad06. Pours dark brown color with an average tan head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate to heavy complex roasted malt, caramel, barrel vanilla, bourbon aroma. Medium to heavy body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Moderate to heavy dark chocolate, caramel, vanilla and alcohol flavor and finish of long duration. Standout beer.

500 ml bottle shared with Tmoney99 from Nimbleprop. Pours dark brown to black in color with a small beige head. The aroma and flavor have roasted malt, caramel, sweet barrel character, vanilla, bourbon, oak, crazy drinkable, the barrel influences are spot on, chocolate, more caramel, vanilla, very solid beer.

Waxed bottle from Corti Bros. Pours dark brown with a slight dark tan head. Aroma of bourbon, chocolate, dark treacle, wood, darkish fruits and whatever! Full bodied. Flavor is bourbon chocolate forward, then wood and darkish fruits. Mild heat burn. Definitely not dry. Chocolate goes dark and earthy. Its really something.

Bottle share. Deep auburn color with a thin beige head. Notes of chocolate, vanilla, toffee, dark fruits and the barrel fill the aroma swirling sweet and a bit boozy. Tastes sweet with the bourbon barrel and vanilla notes, a bit of heat, and mildly bittersweet in the background.

Pitch black, medium tan creamy head, nice lacing. Aroma is of caramalt, chocolate, roasted malt, bourbon barrel, some dark fruit. Taste is medium to very sweet chocolate, toffee, brown sugar, roasted malt, some dark fruit, bourbon barrel, medium roasty bitterness, dryish finish, some alcohol with warmth. Full bodied, creamy-syrupy, soft to flat carbonation. Rich, complex, balanced, just enough bourbon. Superb.
(bottle)
Hugely rich and decadent and a blend that really works. A bit sweet ,a bit of mocha, tons of barrel and bourbon. Almost too much, lots of raisin, fig, vanilla, chocolate and ber-bayn. Damn. Damn.

Bottle shared at Jays music&beer mixing bash. Mode super-decadence ON! Very rich dark chocolate and dried fruit character with a strong lingering bourbon edge, oak, cherry, vanilla, licorice... Endless blend of flavors, more than a beer really, very impressive stuff. Outstanding!
Dominated by the stout in the mix, nice and chocolately, with a lot of vanilla from the barrels. Big and tasty.
Bottle. Thanks Jay. Aroma is great. Boozy, bourbon, lots of it. Taste is smoother, easy drinking, booze, rich, lovely, fruity, bit of bitterness. Nice, surprisingly so.

Bottle at home. Pours opaque black with a medium, frothy tan head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is roast, chocolate and nutty malt, bourbon, oak, vanilla, figs and prunes, light leather notes. Flavor is rich chocolate, roast and nutty malt, vanilla and bourbon with oak notes, prunes and figs with light earthy hops and bitterness and a sweet finish. Full body and medium carbonation.

Bottle pour at home, picked this up at the Brewery a few months back, black pour, big bold flavors, with the bourbon up front, mild chocolate and coffee flavor. Definitely going to see how this beer ages over time.

Bottle thanks to Ken. pours out black topped with a tan head. Nose is nice roast coffee big bourbon barrel vanilla brown sugar sweetness. taste is more of the roast malts bourbon barrel vanilla brown sugar molasses chocolate and a nice rich end.

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2017 From SF: once again first European to rate this-what a honour!
Pours black color, clear, with unstable light brown foamy head. Visually low carbonation. Aroma: prevails note of barley wine, supported with gentle note of imperial stout roadted and dark malts, bourbon barrel, oak, vanilla and dark fruits.
Flavor is practically the same: intense note of barley wine, then steps forward coffee note of porter and gentle roastiness of imperial stout. Bourbon alcohol warmth is gentle noticeable particullary in finish, but not in disturbing way..
Finish is sticky dry. Body is full, texture soft, carbonation is medium. Wow! They crank out damn good beer. My only regret is not getting one more bottle for aging!

This beer have practically nothing in common with american strong ale style, deScripted in BJCP:  for sure it would be more proper to categorize it as a Specialty wood-aged beer.

On tap @ Three Sheets. Very dark brown in color with a khaki head. The bourbon and barrel really dominate here. Its a little hot and boozy for my tastes, but it does have nice chocolate, vanilla, and coconut notes here. Some fruity date and black cherry, too. Quite sweet and sugary, particularly on the tongue. Theres a ton of caramel, brown sugar, and chocolate syrup. A little much, but some nice things here.

Aromas of massive barrel, chocolate, oak, ash, campfire, tobacco, dark fruits, dark malts, black licorice, charred dark malts and pecans. Pours dark as night with enormous lacing and almost no foam whatsoever. Taste is immense with complexity. Notes of barrel, wood, bourbon, chocolate, oak and burnt malt/wood come through first. Then, the beer delves into a plethora of different directions. Notes of cacao, chocolate, slick caramel, toffee, black licorice, thick chocolate, tree bark, dark chocolate, earth, dirt, fudge, and plenty of dark fruits dance around the palate. Finishes with intense earth and bourbon, oak, maple and leather from bourbon barrels. Alcohol is non existent on the palate. A+

Black pour, small tan head, decent lace/retention. Aroma is similar to a a poor mans Firestone Anniversary ale. Notes of oak, bourbon, vanilla, caramel, molasses, chocolate, light roast. Medium to full body, alcohol hidden fairly well. Pretty nice stuff.
I found this beer at Trader Joes. Pours smooth and dark body with a carmal head. I was pleasently surprised how good this beer was and it got better as it warmed up.
Draft. Pours near black with a beige head. Rich and sweet, with chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, molasses, and a bit of booze. Pretty easy drinking, despite the high alcohol and sweetness.
